Name: Ari Hoffman

Name: Henry Clay Dennison

Name: Omari Tahir-Garrett
Summary: Omari Tahir-Garrett is a longtime community activist. His occupation of the former Colman School preceded the creation of the Northwest African American Museum.
Problem: Didn't answer

Name: Phyllis Porter
Summary: Phyllis Porter is a safe-streets advocate and a former vocational-education instructor. She says District 2 needs more housing and police officers.
Problem: Affordability

Name: Tammy Morales
Summary: Tammy Morales was was narrowly defeated in District 2 in 2015. A Rainier Beach community organizer, she previously worked as a consultant on healthful food access.

Name: Ami Nguyen

Problem: Affordability

Name: Egan Orion
Summary: Egan Orion is the executive director of the Capitol Hill Chamber of Commerce. He also manages PrideFest Seattle Center and PrideFest Capitol Hill.

Committee: Human Services, Equitable Development and Renter Rights
Problem: Without a doubt the homelessness crisis and all its parts — the shelter crisis, mental-health and substance-abuse crisis and the affordability crisis — is the most pressing issue in the daily lives of citizens, both sheltered and unsheltered.

Name: Kshama Sawant
Summary: Kshama Sawant is the District 3 incumbent and an activist with the Socialist Alternative Party. First elected in 2013, Sawant has focused on economic and social-justice issues.
Committee: Human Services, Equitable Development and Renter Rights
Problem: We need to make Seattle a city that is affordable for all.

Name: Logan Bowers
Summary: Logan Bowers and his wife own a cannabis store in Fremont. He used to work at Amazon and says Seattle needs denser housing.
Problem: We have more people than we have homes and it’s leading to skyrocketing costs, displacement and increased homelessness.

Name: Pat Murakami
Summary: Pat Murakami is the longtime president of the Southeast Seattle Crime Prevention Council. She ran for a City Council seat in 2017 and was defeated in the general election.
Problem: Out-of-state/country developers purchasing large parcels/developments without oversight by city leadership, resulting in unaffordable residential and commercial rental rates and mistreatment of tenants

Name: Zachary DeWolf
Summary: Zachary DeWolf is serving his first term on the Seattle School Board. He works as a program manager for All Home, King County’s coordinating agency on homelessness.
Problem: We need to address homelessness.

Name: Alex Pedersen
Summary: Alex Pedersen was most recently a manager at a company that helps to preserve affordable housing. He previously worked for former Councilmember Tim Burgess.
Problem: Residents and local businesses want and deserve more accountability from their City Council.

Name: Beth Mountsier
Summary: Beth Mountsier is a local-government policy expert who spent more than 15 years as a King County Council analyst. She co-chairs the University Heights Community center board.

Problem: Critical leadership and technical expertise on housing (including affordable), land use and zoning that will create a more livable city for all

Name: Cathy Tuttle
Summary: Cathy Tuttle worked for Seattle Parks and Recreation and then founded Seattle Neighborhood Greenways, which advocates for safer streets.

Name: Ethan Hunter

Name: Alex Tsimerman

Name: Dan Strauss

Name: Jay Fathi

Name: Joey Massa

Name: Jon Lisbin
Summary: Jon Lisbin is the president of Seattle Fair Growth and helped challenge the city's recent neighborhood-upzone plan.
